fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: Childcare bar to economy A lack of high-quality, affordable childcare is acting as a "serious brake" on London's economy, the mayor, Ken Livingstone, will warn today, because it is preventing women from returning to the workforce. Women held in road protest Two women were arrested yesterday today after locking themselves to a digger during a protest against a £50m bypass outside Linslade, Bedfordshire. Jewish graves desecrated Racists have daubed Nazi signs on gravestones in a Jewish cemetery in Aldershot, Hampshire police said yesterday. Ten headstones were covered with swastikas. Banned from using front door Luke Davies, 17, from Blaenavon, Gwent was yesterday banned from using his front door until he is 21 under an antisocial behaviour order. He will have to enter his home through the back door. Cow rescued from pool Firefighters spent more than two hours yesterday rescuing a cow which had fallen into a swimming pool at Butleigh, Somerset. A spokeswoman said: "We have no idea how the cow got into the pool." Chicken's luck runs out A chicken which helped its owner pick winning lottery numbers by tapping digits into a calculator has been eaten by a fox. Lucky the chicken's number was up when its owner in Audlem, Cheshire forgot to lock its coop.
